vocabularyDefinition.en: Act with intended legal effects. Know-how action aimed at establishing, modifying, transferring, terminating or affirming legal obligations or rights.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Act with intended legal effects. Know-how action aimed at establishing, modifying, transferring, terminating or affirming legal obligations or rights.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: includes administrative acts and court decisions. Also includes applications, notifications, formal records and other administrative and judicial acts committed by public authorities as well as citizens and businesses. Also includes tacit acts, such as tacit taking of a deed or refusal.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: includes administrative acts and court decisions. Also includes applications, notifications, formal records and other administrative and judicial acts committed by public authorities as well as citizens and businesses. Also includes tacit acts, such as tacit taking of a deed or refusal.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Publication of the Legal Act.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Publication of the Legal Act.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The Content of the Legal Act.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The Content of the Legal Act.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Publication of the Legal Act in a Document.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Publication of the Legal Act in a Document.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Date from which the Legal Transaction becomes effective.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Date from which the Legal Transaction becomes effective.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: For example, the date of a judgment.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: For example, the date of a judgment.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The Identifier of the Legal Act.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The Identifier of the Legal Act.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The Legal Categories under which the Legal Act can be classified.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The Legal Categories under which the Legal Act can be classified.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: The code list used may be different from the one used for an Activity.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Legal subject legally responsible for the Legal Act.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Legal subject legally responsible for the Legal Act.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Set of actions that one or more Legal Subjects (want to) perform (or have carried out) within a specific period of time and at a specific location and which, given their nature, can be qualified and are therefore regulated under one or more well-defined Legal Categories.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Set of actions that one or more Legal Subjects (want to) perform (or have carried out) within a specific period of time and at a specific location and which, given their nature, can be qualified and are therefore regulated under one or more well-defined Legal Categories.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: Is the subject of permit applications, notifications, permit decisions, determinations.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: Is the subject of permit applications, notifications, permit decisions, determinations.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The description of the Activity.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The description of the Activity.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Reference to Comprehensive Activity.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Reference to Comprehensive Activity.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: Allows a complex Activity to be developed as a nested data structure.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: Allows a complex Activity to be developed as a nested data structure.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The Legal Qualification of the Activity.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The Legal Qualification of the Activity.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: The code list used may be different from that used for Legal Acts.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Indication of the place where an Activity takes place, will take place, or has taken place.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Indication of the place where an Activity takes place, will take place, or has taken place.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Legal subject responsible for the Activity.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Legal subject responsible for the Activity.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Indication of the time frame of the Activity.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Indication of the time frame of the Activity.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Action, emanating from a board, which alters the legal situation or prevents it from being changed.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Action, emanating from a board, which alters the legal situation or prevents it from being changed.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: Examples of unilateral administrative legal acts are: decisions of general application, issuing regulations, decisions such as recognitions and permits and deeds. Expand this class with the necessary specilizations or typifications.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: Examples of unilateral administrative legal acts are: decisions of general application, issuing regulations, decisions such as recognitions and permits and deeds. Expand this class with the necessary specilizations or typifications.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The Public Organisation responsible for the Administrative Legal Act.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The Public Organisation responsible for the Administrative Legal Act.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Disclosure to the general public.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Disclosure to the general public.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: In the context of environmental permit applications, a posting is a form of publication. This also applies to the announcement on the website of a municipality. Use Notification for a targeted disclosure to a data subject.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: In the context of environmental permit applications, a posting is a form of publication. This also applies to the announcement on the website of a municipality. Use Notification for a targeted disclosure to a data subject.

vocabularyDefinition.en: A formal act performed in the context of a Case.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: A formal act performed in the context of a Case.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: These may be legal acts, but also administrative acts. In case management systems that implement CMMN, this entity corresponds to a PlanItem.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: These may be legal acts, but also administrative acts. In case management systems that implement CMMN, this entity corresponds to a PlanItem.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The case in which the Act of Case is performed.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The case in which the Act of Case is performed.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The procedural step according to which the Act of Case is performed.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The procedural step according to which the Act of Case is performed.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Legal person who is legally responsible for the Conduct of the Case.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Legal person who is legally responsible for the Conduct of the Case.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Classification of the Case Transaction on the basis of a controlled code list.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Classification of the Case Transaction on the basis of a controlled code list.

vocabularyDefinition.en: That which constitutes a legal act.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: That which constitutes a legal act.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: Can be a request, a report, a determination, a normative provision, a procedural decision, and so on. A single legal act may contain several substantive points. Users are prompted to classify the type of content according to common code lists.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: Can be a request, a report, a determination, a normative provision, a procedural decision, and so on. A single legal act may contain several substantive points. Users are prompted to classify the type of content according to common code lists.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Legal obligations that legal subjects take up against each other (legal acts) or incur (legal facts).

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Legal obligations that legal subjects take up against each other (legal acts) or incur (legal facts).

vocabularyUsageNote.en: For example, a burden or condition in an environmental permit.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: For example, a burden or condition in an environmental permit.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Judicial Authority.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Judicial Authority.

vocabularyDefinition.en: A formal decision or judgment of a court of law, delivered by a judge or panel of judges.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: A formal decision or judgment of a court of law, delivered by a judge or panel of judges.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: In the context of environmental permits, this includes the rulings of the Council for Permit Disputes and the Council of State.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: In the context of environmental permits, this includes the rulings of the Council for Permit Disputes and the Council of State.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The Court of Justice responsible for the Judicial Decision.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The Court of Justice responsible for the Judicial Decision.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The determination/determination of the licensed condition at a certain point in time, based on the information available at that time about relevant legal facts (environmental permit: Events) that have had an impact on the licensed condition.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The determination/determination of the licensed condition at a certain point in time, based on the information available at that time about relevant legal facts (environmental permit: Events) that have had an impact on the licensed condition.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Time of adoption.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Time of adoption.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Events from which the Licensed Condition is derived.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Events from which the Licensed Condition is derived.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The Public Organization is responsible for determining the Licensed Condition.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The Public Organization is responsible for determining the Licensed Condition.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Truthfulness, such as an (electronic) signature or seal issued by an authorised Legal Subject.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Truthfulness, such as an (electronic) signature or seal issued by an authorised Legal Subject.

vocabularyDefinition.en: By Legal Category we mean rubrics, classifications or legally anchored characterizations.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: By Legal Category we mean rubrics, classifications or legally anchored characterizations.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: A legal qualification is made on the basis of legal references, i.e. references to Legal Works. It is possible to make a legal qualification on different dimensions (e.g. qualifying an activity in terms of classification headings and in terms of Sevezo regulations).

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: A legal qualification is made on the basis of legal references, i.e. references to Legal Works. It is possible to make a legal qualification on different dimensions (e.g. qualifying an activity in terms of classification headings and in terms of Sevezo regulations).

vocabularyDefinition.en: The legal source of the Legal Category.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The legal source of the Legal Category.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Legal facts as well as legal acts and case actions within the context of an environmental permit.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Legal facts as well as legal acts and case actions within the context of an environmental permit.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: Is an abstract class: use specializations. These events form the basis on which the Licensed Condition is determined.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: Is an abstract class: use specializations. These events form the basis on which the Licensed Condition is determined.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Entity that is subject to the law, that is or may be the bearer of rights and obligations (Legal Relationships), and that is considered capable of carrying out legal acts or having them carried out in its name (on its behalf).

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Entity that is subject to the law, that is or may be the bearer of rights and obligations (Legal Relationships), and that is considered capable of carrying out legal acts or having them carried out in its name (on its behalf).

vocabularyUsageNote.en: Includes both natural persons (people) and legal entities. Includes both private and public entities. Can enter into contracts, own property, be held liable for crimes, and so on. In the context of environmental permits: the applicant for a permit, the licensing authority, the Council for Permit Disputes, the operator of a nuisance establishment, the executor of urban development activities, the reporter of an irregularity, and so on. Legal subject is similar in concept to OSLO generic:Agent (also collective term for natural and legal persons and defined as "someone who can act or have an effect"), but is narrower than Agent and specific to the legal context (including administrative law, including permit policy), and is therefore preferred in the context of environmental permits because of this legal connotation.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: Includes both natural persons (people) and legal entities. Includes both private and public entities. Can enter into contracts, own property, be held liable for crimes, and so on. In the context of environmental permits: the applicant for a permit, the licensing authority, the Council for Permit Disputes, the operator of a nuisance establishment, the executor of urban development activities, the reporter of an irregularity, and so on. Legal subject is similar in concept to OSLO generic:Agent (also collective term for natural and legal persons and defined as "someone who can act or have an effect"), but is narrower than Agent and specific to the legal context (including administrative law, including permit policy), and is therefore preferred in the context of environmental permits because of this legal connotation.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Works formatted for legal purposes.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Works formatted for legal purposes.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: Includes, among other things, legislation and regulations, public and private legal acts of courts, administrative bodies and other legal entities. This also includes legal doctrine, as well as legal typologies (Legal Category). Technocratic instruments, such as standards, specifications and implementations thereof that fulfil a legal function are covered by this entity. A Legal Work is usually reflected in one or more Documents. The legal value of a Legal Work depends, among other things, on the existence of an authentic version (Document) that has been published in accordance with the provisions laid down. Broader than http://data.europa.eu/eli/ontology#LegalResource which is limited to legislative works.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: Includes, among other things, legislation and regulations, public and private legal acts of courts, administrative bodies and other legal entities. This also includes legal doctrine, as well as legal typologies (Legal Category). Technocratic instruments, such as standards, specifications and implementations thereof that fulfil a legal function are covered by this entity. A Legal Work is usually reflected in one or more Documents. The legal value of a Legal Work depends, among other things, on the existence of an authentic version (Document) that has been published in accordance with the provisions laid down. Broader than http://data.europa.eu/eli/ontology#LegalResource which is limited to legislative works.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Structured Identifier of Legal Work.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Structured Identifier of Legal Work.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: For example, criminal statements can make use of the ECLI identification scheme. Legislative works are in scope of ELI. Another example, the structured identifier of an environmental decree in a municipality's management system.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: For example, criminal statements can make use of the ECLI identification scheme. Legislative works are in scope of ELI. Another example, the structured identifier of an environmental decree in a municipality's management system.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The Legal Act, being a decision, which implies authorization for an Activity.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The Legal Act, being a decision, which implies authorization for an Activity.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The set of rights and obligations, with regard to the scope of the environmental permits, that apply to the object of the licensed situation at a certain point in time.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The set of rights and obligations, with regard to the scope of the environmental permits, that apply to the object of the licensed situation at a certain point in time.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: A licensed condition contains (references to) Normative Provisions. In the context of the environmental permit, the object of the licensed condition is often a location such as a building, a plot or an area. A Licensed Condition is inextricably linked to its Establishment.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: A licensed condition contains (references to) Normative Provisions. In the context of the environmental permit, the object of the licensed condition is often a location such as a building, a plot or an area. A Licensed Condition is inextricably linked to its Establishment.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Indication of the date of the Licensed Condition.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Indication of the date of the Licensed Condition.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The act by which the Licensed Condition is recorded.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The act by which the Licensed Condition is recorded.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The Normative Provisions that are valid in the context of a particular Licensed Condition.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The Normative Provisions that are valid in the context of a particular Licensed Condition.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The spatial determination for which the licensed condition is determined.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The spatial determination for which the licensed condition is determined.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Lodging an appeal in relation to a specific legal act that can be challenged.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Lodging an appeal in relation to a specific legal act that can be challenged.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: For example, the lodging of an administrative appeal against a specific municipal permit decision in the first instance. Lodging a judicial appeal against a specific decision at last administrative instance.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: For example, the lodging of an administrative appeal against a specific municipal permit decision in the first instance. Lodging a judicial appeal against a specific decision at last administrative instance.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Party Pursuing the Appeal.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Party Pursuing the Appeal.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Reference to the possibility of appeal.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Reference to the possibility of appeal.

vocabularyDefinition.en: A provision that creates, amends, terminates or confirms a legal norm.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: A provision that creates, amends, terminates or confirms a legal norm.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: May be of general or individual application. It may be a right or obligation.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: May be of general or individual application. It may be a right or obligation.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The object of the Normative Provision.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The object of the Normative Provision.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Indication of the time frame of the Normative Provision.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Indication of the time frame of the Normative Provision.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: The authorisation to carry out a particular Activity may be limited in time.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: The authorisation to carry out a particular Activity may be limited in time.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Procedural step that provides the possibility to challenge an administrative legal act or court decision.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Procedural step that provides the possibility to challenge an administrative legal act or court decision.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: Possibility to appeal against a municipal permit decision at first instance. Or a judicial appeal against a decision of last administrative instance.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: Possibility to appeal against a municipal permit decision at first instance. Or a judicial appeal against a decision of last administrative instance.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The Public Organisation authorised to rule on the Appeal.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The Public Organisation authorised to rule on the Appeal.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Period within which the Remedy may be exercised.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Period within which the Remedy may be exercised.

vocabularyDefinition.en: A Procedure is the blueprint for the settlement of a Case.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: A Procedure is the blueprint for the settlement of a Case.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: It contains Procedural Steps such as a Remedie. The Procedural Steps determine the possible follow-up actions in the Case and the time limits. In case management systems that implement CMMN, this entity corresponds to a CasePlanModel.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: It contains Procedural Steps such as a Remedie. The Procedural Steps determine the possible follow-up actions in the Case and the time limits. In case management systems that implement CMMN, this entity corresponds to a CasePlanModel.

vocabularyDefinition.en: References to the Legal Works on which the Proceedings are based.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: References to the Legal Works on which the Proceedings are based.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: For example, the procedure for the simplified permit procedure is laid down in Articles 37 et seq. of the Environmental Decree, as in force on a certain date.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: For example, the procedure for the simplified permit procedure is laid down in Articles 37 et seq. of the Environmental Decree, as in force on a certain date.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The Procedural Steps that are part of a Procedure.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The Procedural Steps that are part of a Procedure.
The Public Organisations that may have jurisdiction over the Procedure.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Period within which the Procedure may be applied.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Period within which the Procedure may be applied.

vocabularyDefinition.en: A Procedure Step is a prescribed action within a Procedure.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: A Procedure Step is a prescribed action within a Procedure.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: Used to indicate the type of action required by the Procedure. The Case Act implements the procedural step with regard to a specific Case.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: Used to indicate the type of action required by the Procedure. The Case Act implements the procedural step with regard to a specific Case.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Entitlement to the exercise of a power; formal request by a legal person to a competent authority to provide information or to take a decision, in particular a decision to authorise something.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Entitlement to the exercise of a power; formal request by a legal person to a competent authority to provide information or to take a decision, in particular a decision to authorise something.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: In the context of environmental permits, this concerns all applications from or relating to environmental permits.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: In the context of environmental permits, this concerns all applications from or relating to environmental permits.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Legal person(s) submitting the application or on whose behalf it is submitted.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Legal person(s) submitting the application or on whose behalf it is submitted.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The permission to carry out a certain activity in a specific location, for which, at the time of application or notification, a specific permit or notification is required according to the regulations in force in the field of spatial planning and the environment.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The permission to carry out a certain activity in a specific location, for which, at the time of application or notification, a specific permit or notification is required according to the regulations in force in the field of spatial planning and the environment.

Also includes applications, notifications, formal records and other administrative and judicial acts committed by public authorities as well as citizens and businesses. Can enter into contracts, own property, be held liable for crimes, and so on. In the context of environmental permits: the applicant for a permit, the licensing authority, the Council for Permit Disputes, the operator of a nuisance establishment, the executor of urban development activities, the reporter of an irregularity, and so on. Legal subject is similar in concept to OSLO generic:Agent (also collective term for natural and legal persons and defined as "someone who can act or have an effect"), but is narrower than Agent and specific to the legal context (including administrative law, including permit policy), and is therefore preferred in the context of environmental permits because of this legal connotation.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: Includes both natural persons (people) and legal entities. Includes both private and public entities. Can enter into contracts, own property, be held liable for crimes, and so on. In the context of environmental permits: the applicant for a permit, the licensing authority, the Council for Permit Disputes, the operator of a nuisance establishment, the executor of urban development activities, the reporter of an irregularity, and so on. Legal subject is similar in concept to OSLO generic:Agent (also collective term for natural and legal persons and defined as "someone who can act or have an effect"), but is narrower than Agent and specific to the legal context (including administrative law, including permit policy), and is therefore preferred in the context of environmental permits because of this legal connotation.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Works formatted for legal purposes.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Works formatted for legal purposes.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: Includes, among other things, legislation and regulations, public and private legal acts of courts, administrative bodies and other legal entities. This also includes legal doctrine, as well as legal typologies (Legal Category). Technocratic instruments, such as standards, specifications and implementations thereof that fulfil a legal function are covered by this entity. A Legal Work is usually reflected in one or more Documents. The legal value of a Legal Work depends, among other things, on the existence of an authentic version (Document) that has been published in accordance with the provisions laid down. Broader than http://data.europa.eu/eli/ontology#LegalResource which is limited to legislative works.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: Includes, among other things, legislation and regulations, public and private legal acts of courts, administrative bodies and other legal entities. This also includes legal doctrine, as well as legal typologies (Legal Category). Technocratic instruments, such as standards, specifications and implementations thereof that fulfil a legal function are covered by this entity. A Legal Work is usually reflected in one or more Documents. The legal value of a Legal Work depends, among other things, on the existence of an authentic version (Document) that has been published in accordance with the provisions laid down. Broader than http://data.europa.eu/eli/ontology#LegalResource which is limited to legislative works.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: For example, criminal statements can make use of the ECLI identification scheme. Legislative works are in scope of ELI. Another example, the structured identifier of an environmental decree in a municipality's management system.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The set of rights and obligations, with regard to the scope of the environmental permits, that apply to the object of the licensed situation at a certain point in time.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: A licensed condition contains (references to) Normative Provisions. In the context of the environmental permit, the object of the licensed condition is often a location such as a building, a plot or an area. A Licensed Condition is inextricably linked to its Establishment.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: A licensed condition contains (references to) Normative Provisions. In the context of the environmental permit, the object of the licensed condition is often a location such as a building, a plot or an area. applicationProfileUsageNote.en: Includes, among other things, legislation and regulations, public and private legal acts of courts, administrative bodies and other legal entities. This also includes legal doctrine, as well as legal typologies (Legal Category). Technocratic instruments, such as standards, specifications and implementations thereof that fulfil a legal function are covered by this entity. A Legal Work is usually reflected in one or more Documents. The legal value of a Legal Work depends, among other things, on the existence of an authentic version (Document) that has been published in accordance with the provisions laid down. Broader than http://data.europa.eu/eli/ontology#LegalResource which is limited to legislative works.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Structured Identifier of Legal Work.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Structured Identifier of Legal Work.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: For example, criminal statements can make use of the ECLI identification scheme. Legislative works are in scope of ELI. Another example, the structured identifier of an environmental decree in a municipality's management system.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: For example, criminal statements can make use of the ECLI identification scheme. Legislative works are in scope of ELI. Another example, the structured identifier of an environmental decree in a municipality's management system.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The Legal Act, being a decision, which implies authorization for an Activity.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The Legal Act, being a decision, which implies authorization for an Activity.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The set of rights and obligations, with regard to the scope of the environmental permits, that apply to the object of the licensed situation at a certain point in time.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The set of rights and obligations, with regard to the scope of the environmental permits, that apply to the object of the licensed situation at a certain point in time.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: A licensed condition contains (references to) Normative Provisions. In the context of the environmental permit, the object of the licensed condition is often a location such as a building, a plot or an area. A Licensed Condition is inextricably linked to its Establishment.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: A licensed condition contains (references to) Normative Provisions. In the context of the environmental permit, the object of the licensed condition is often a location such as a building, a plot or an area. A Licensed Condition is inextricably linked to its Establishment.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Indication of the date of the Licensed Condition.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Indication of the date of the Licensed Condition.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The act by which the Licensed Condition is recorded.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The act by which the Licensed Condition is recorded.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The Normative Provisions that are valid in the context of a particular Licensed Condition.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The Normative Provisions that are valid in the context of a particular Licensed Condition.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The spatial determination for which the licensed condition is determined.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The spatial determination for which the licensed condition is determined.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Lodging an appeal in relation to a specific legal act that can be challenged.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Lodging an appeal in relation to a specific legal act that can be challenged.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: For example, the lodging of an administrative appeal against a specific municipal permit decision in the first instance. Lodging a judicial appeal against a specific decision at last administrative instance.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: For example, the lodging of an administrative appeal against a specific municipal permit decision in the first instance. Lodging a judicial appeal against a specific decision at last administrative instance.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Party Pursuing the Appeal.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Party Pursuing the Appeal.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Reference to the possibility of appeal.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Reference to the possibility of appeal.

vocabularyDefinition.en: A provision that creates, amends, terminates or confirms a legal norm.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: A provision that creates, amends, terminates or confirms a legal norm.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: May be of general or individual application. It may be a right or obligation.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: May be of general or individual application. It may be a right or obligation.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The object of the Normative Provision.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The object of the Normative Provision.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Indication of the time frame of the Normative Provision.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Indication of the time frame of the Normative Provision.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: The authorisation to carry out a particular Activity may be limited in time.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: The authorisation to carry out a particular Activity may be limited in time.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Procedural step that provides the possibility to challenge an administrative legal act or court decision.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Procedural step that provides the possibility to challenge an administrative legal act or court decision.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: Possibility to appeal against a municipal permit decision at first instance. Or a judicial appeal against a decision of last administrative instance.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: Possibility to appeal against a municipal permit decision at first instance. Or a judicial appeal against a decision of last administrative instance.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The Public Organisation authorised to rule on the Appeal.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The Public Organisation authorised to rule on the Appeal.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Period within which the Remedy may be exercised.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Period within which the Remedy may be exercised.

vocabularyDefinition.en: A Procedure is the blueprint for the settlement of a Case.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: A Procedure is the blueprint for the settlement of a Case.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: It contains Procedural Steps such as a Remedie. The Procedural Steps determine the possible follow-up actions in the Case and the time limits. In case management systems that implement CMMN, this entity corresponds to a CasePlanModel.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: It contains Procedural Steps such as a Remedie. The Procedural Steps determine the possible follow-up actions in the Case and the time limits. In case management systems that implement CMMN, this entity corresponds to a CasePlanModel.

vocabularyDefinition.en: References to the Legal Works on which the Proceedings are based.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: References to the Legal Works on which the Proceedings are based.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: For example, the procedure for the simplified permit procedure is laid down in Articles 37 et seq. of the Environmental Decree, as in force on a certain date.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: For example, the procedure for the simplified permit procedure is laid down in Articles 37 et seq. of the Environmental Decree, as in force on a certain date.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The Procedural Steps that are part of a Procedure.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The Procedural Steps that are part of a Procedure.
The Public Organisations that may have jurisdiction over the Procedure.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Period within which the Procedure may be applied.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Period within which the Procedure may be applied.

vocabularyDefinition.en: A Procedure Step is a prescribed action within a Procedure.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: A Procedure Step is a prescribed action within a Procedure.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: Used to indicate the type of action required by the Procedure. The Case Act implements the procedural step with regard to a specific Case.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: Used to indicate the type of action required by the Procedure. The Case Act implements the procedural step with regard to a specific Case.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Entitlement to the exercise of a power; formal request by a legal person to a competent authority to provide information or to take a decision, in particular a decision to authorise something.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Entitlement to the exercise of a power; formal request by a legal person to a competent authority to provide information or to take a decision, in particular a decision to authorise something.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: In the context of environmental permits, this concerns all applications from or relating to environmental permits.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: In the context of environmental permits, this concerns all applications from or relating to environmental permits.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Legal person(s) submitting the application or on whose behalf it is submitted.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Legal person(s) submitting the application or on whose behalf it is submitted.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The permission to carry out a certain activity in a specific location, for which, at the time of application or notification, a specific permit or notification is required according to the regulations in force in the field of spatial planning and the environment.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The permission to carry out a certain activity in a specific location, for which, at the time of application or notification, a specific permit or notification is required according to the regulations in force in the field of spatial planning and the environment.
